node.title: Steroid debate again headlines baseball HOF votes
node.description: The Baseball Hall of Fame has released its 2022 ballot, and voters will be confronting the sport's steroid era once again.

node.title: Kevin Spacey was ordered to pay $31 million to the ‘House of Cards’ studio after sexual harassment allegations.
node.description: A secret arbitrator’s ruling was issued 13 months ago and became public on Monday when lawyers for the studio petitioned a California court to confirm the award.

node.title: Doctor Who Swabbed Cuomo Describes a Health Department in Shambles
node.description: The N.Y. Health Department became a “toxic work environment” early in the pandemic, a senior official told officials investigating ex-Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo.

node.title: Mom Defends Her Baby's Midnight Bedtime in Controversial Video Viewed 1M Times
node.description: "Time is a man made thing. So she sleeps from 12:00 am [to] 1:00 pm and that's what works best for our family," the TikToker said.

node.title: Ex-Netanyahu Aide Says Politician a 'Control Freak' Over His Image During Corruption Trial
node.description: Nir Hefetz, the ex-aide, said that "Netanyahu spends at least as much of his time on media as he spends on security matters."

node.title: Democratic Donors Hit Pause as Party Debates Whether to Focus on Race In 2022
node.description: Some Democrats acknowledge a "Catch 22" — that while issues of race deeply matter to Democratic voters, talking about them is exactly what Republicans want.

node.title: Calls to ban 'no grounds' evictions as renters pushed to 'brink of homelessness'
node.description: Tenant advisory services in regional NSW are overwhelmed by renters seeking help after being evicted without cause — with some so desperate they are threatening suicide.

node.title: Queensland's COVID test mandate for travellers questioned by federal Health Minister
node.description: Federal Health Minister Greg Hunt has written to Queensland's Health Minister Yvette D'Ath asking her to reconsider the state's demand that interstate travellers be tested for COVID before their journey, saying it is contrary to national recommendations.

node.title: 'My last chance to find out the truth': Mother calls for coronial inquest into teenager's death
node.description: The mother of a teenage girl who died from self-inflicted injuries moments after a mental health appointment says a coronial inquest will provide the last chance to find out the truth about the 13-year-old's death.

node.title: Jubilant travellers cross into SA as drawbridge lowers to eastern states
node.description: For months an effective fortress with almost no COVID-19 cases, South Australia is now welcoming double-vaccinated travellers from NSW, Victoria and the ACT, with many expressing their delight.

node.title: Too many board members around for too long - advisory firm
node.description: Too many board members are out of touch with their companies and the digital era, with changes needed at the top, according to an advisory firm.

node.title: Argosy reports strong first half result
node.description: The diversified property investor reported a strong first half result with revaluation gains and revenue growth.

node.title: 'Disgrace' - Developers, iwi, criticise housing intensification bill
node.description: Developers have told MPs they do not want a housing intensification bill that gives them open slather across swathes of suburbia. Developers have told MPs they do not want a...

node.title: Disney lifts vaccine mandate for employees at Disney World
node.description: Florida law bars employers from requiring vaccinations, though Disney says 90% of its workers are already inoculated.

node.title: Your Tuesday Briefing
node.description: Austria entered a nationwide lockdown.

node.title: Trump-Backed Senate Candidate Sean Parnell Suspends Campaign Amid Custody Battle
node.description: A judge granted Parnell's wife sole legal custody of their children. She alleges that he abused her for years.

node.title: These 5 companies are already building the metaverse
node.description: Facebook would like to own the metaverse, but Apple, Microsoft and Valve have a head start with products you can buy today.

node.title: Overheating the Economy Now Could Mean Trouble Later
node.description: Now that Jerome Powell has been renominated to head the Federal Reserve, he needs to turn the temperature down.

node.title: Four Black Men Wrongly Charged With Rape Are Exonerated 72 Years Later
node.description: The men, known as the Groveland Four, were cleared on Monday after a Florida prosecutor said “a complete breakdown of the criminal justice system” led to the charges in 1949.

node.title: Students, ACLU Petition District to Return 2 LGBTQ Books Removed After Parent Complaints
node.description: A petition organized by the Northland Student Association had gained more than 1,000 signatures by Monday afternoon.

node.title: Have you purchased seeds online from overseas? That's probably illegal
node.description: Online shopping company eBay has been working with Australia's Agriculture Department to weed out unidentified seeds and live plants coming into the country in the mail.

node.title: On the Farm - a wrap of farming conditions around NZ
node.description: Country Life: Hot, windy weather has been very drying for Hawke's Bay and in Nelson, the bees have been taken out of gold kiwifruit blocks and are now in with the green.

node.title: Reserve Bank interest rate rise likely foregone conclusion
node.description: Another interest rate rise from the Reserve Bank seems a foregone conclusion this Wednesday.

node.title: Adele gets Spotify to take shuffle off all album pages
node.description: Adele has persuaded Spotify to take the shuffle button off all album pages so tracks play in the artist's own order.

node.title: Treasury put aside 10 times amount of money paid to abused Lake Alice patients
node.description: Government documents uncovered from more than 20 years ago have shown Treasury earmarked more than $130 million to resolve legal claims from former patients of psychiatric institution Lake Alice.

node.title: Waitemata DHB seeks 133 new staff to deal with Covid-19 in community
node.description: Auckland's Waitemata District Health Board is looking for 133 extra staff, including 21 intensive care nurses, to help it cope with Covid-19 next year.

node.title: Uber Eats says customers can pick up their weed in Ontario
node.description: Delivery app customers in the Canadian province can now use it to order cannabis, although they must pick it up themselves.

node.title: Here's how much more you're paying for food and fuel
node.description: Household budgets are feeling the pinch as inflation rises, pushing up the cost of staples like gas and milk.

node.title: Ms. Holmes begins rebutting one of the prosecution’s key arguments.
node.description: Prosecutors said Theranos had lied about endorsements from pharmaceutical companies to land funding. Ms. Holmes testified that Theranos had indeed worked with drug makers.

node.title: Sean Parnell Suspends G.O.P. Senate Bid in Pennsylvania
node.description: Mr. Parnell, who was endorsed by Donald Trump in one of the highest-profile 2022 Senate races, had been accused by his estranged wife of spousal and child abuse.
